div.l: Alas oure wardeyn · hath his palfrey lorn
This Alayn al forgate both mele and corn
Al was out of mynde · his husbandrie
What whiche wey is he gan · he gan to crye
The wif cam lepyng In with a renne
She saide alas yowre hors · is in the fenne
With wield mares · as fast as he may go
Vnthank on his handes · that band hym so
And he that better · shuld have knyt the Rayne
Alas quod Iohn Alas for cristes peyne
Lay doun̄ thy swerd · and I wil myn alswa
I am ful wight god wate · as is a Ra
Bi goddis herte · he shal nat scape vs bath
Whi had thow nat put the capul in the lath
Ilhaile bi god Alayn thow is a fonne
Thiese cely clerkis han ful fast I Ronne
Toward the fenne · both Alayn and eeke Iohn
And whan the Miller saw · that they were gon
He half a busshel of theyr floure hath take
And bad his wif · go knede it in a cake
He saide I trowe · the clerkis were aferd
Yit can a Miller · make a clerkis berd
For al theyr art · ye lete hem gon theyr way
Lo wher he goth · ye lete the chieldren play
They gete hym nought so lightly be my crowne
Thiese cely clerkis · rennen vp and doun̄
With kepe kepe stand stand Iossa garderere
Ga whistel thow · and I shal kepe hym heere
But shortly til it was verray nyght
